page.title: 10Gimethorpe Junior Band
page.content: The Junior Band was formed on 3rd February, 1960 and this year celebrates its 25th anniversary. The first conductor of the band was FRED SILVER and from 1962 to 1964 KEN JOHNSON conducted the band and his first ten contest results were seven first, two second, and one fourth place. He also conducted the first Junior Band B.B.C. Broadcast for the SOUND OFF programme. Under the late WILLIAM LIPPEATT the Junior Band was invited to perform in the Festival Concert at the Royal Albert Hall in 1967.The band also appeared three times in Hughie Green's television talent show OPPORTUNITY KNOCK'S. The Junior Band over the 25 year period has had its ups and downs.Mr. Stan Lippeatt is now re-building the band from children in local schools.
